Text: Contend, O LORD, with those who contend with me; fight against those who fight against me.
Context: David is calling upon God to take up his cause against his enemies.

Text: Take up shield and buckler; arise and come to my aid.
Context: David is metaphorically asking God to arm Himself and come to his defense.

Text: Brandish spear and javelin against those who pursue me. Say to my soul, “I am your salvation.”
Context: David seeks assurance of God's protection against his pursuers.

Text: May those who seek my life be disgraced and put to shame; may those who plot my ruin be turned back in dismay.
Context: David implores that his enemies experience defeat and shame.

Text: May they be like chaff before the wind, with the angel of the LORD driving them away.
Context: David asks for his adversaries to be scattered helplessly.

Text: May their path be dark and slippery, with the angel of the LORD pursuing them.
Context: David wishes for treacherous circumstances to befall his enemies.

Text: Without cause they hid their net for me; without cause they dug a pit for my soul.
Context: David speaks of the unjust traps set by his enemies.

Text: May ruin overtake them by surprise; may the net they hid ensnare them; may they fall into the pit, to their ruin.
Context: David desires an ironic justice for his foes, that their schemes backfire unexpectedly.

Text: Then my soul will rejoice in the LORD and delight in His salvation.
Context: David expresses anticipated joy in the deliverance he expects from God.

Text: All my bones will exclaim, “Who is like You, O LORD, who rescues the poor from the strong, the poor and needy from those who rob them?”
Context: David's praise is so profound it is as if his very bones cry out.

Text: Malicious witnesses come forward; they question me on things I know nothing about.
Context: David is confronted with false accusations from dishonest witnesses.

Text: They repay me evil for good, to the bereavement of my soul.
Context: David laments the repay of good with evil, causing deep sorrow.

Text: Yet when they were ill, I put on sackcloth; I humbled myself with fasting, but my prayers returned to me unanswered.
Context: David recalls his own past compassion for his enemies, despite the lack of reciprocity.

Text: I paced about as though for my friend or brother; I was bowed down with grief, like one mourning for his mother.
Context: David describes the depth of his grief for his adversaries as if for a close family member.

Text: But when I stumbled, they gathered in glee; attackers gathered against me without my knowledge. They slandered me without ceasing.
Context: David details the malicious response of his enemies to his misfortune.

Text: Like godless jesters at a feast, they gnashed their teeth at me.
Context: David depicts his adversaries as mocking him cruelly.

Text: How long, O Lord, will You look on? Rescue my soul from their ravages, my precious life from these lions.
Context: David cries out to God for rescue from his vicious enemies.

Text: I will give You thanks in the great assembly; among the mighty throng I will praise You.
Context: David promises public praise and thanksgiving to God upon deliverance.

Text: May those who gloat over my distress not be put to shame; may those who exalt themselves over me without cause not triumph.
Context: David prays that his enemies do not find satisfaction in his troubles.

Text: For they do not speak peace, but they devise deceitful schemes against the quiet ones in the land.
Context: David accuses his enemies of plotting against those who live peacefully.

Text: They gape at me and say, “Aha, aha! Our eyes have seen it.”
Context: David is subjected to gloating and false accusations as his enemies claim to have witnessed his fault.

Text: O LORD, You have seen this; do not be silent. Do not be far from me, O Lord.
Context: David appeals to God's omniscience and begs for His presence and intervention.

Text: Awake and rise to my defense, to my cause, O God and my Lord.
Context: David implores God to take action on his behalf in a legal metaphor.

Text: Vindicate me by Your righteousness, O LORD my God; do not let them gloat over me.
Context: David asks for divine judgment in his favor to prevent his enemies from rejoicing in his misfortune.

Text: May they not say in their hearts, “Aha, just what we wanted!” May they not say, “We have swallowed him up!”
Context: David wishes to prevent his enemies from achieving their malicious desires.

Text: May all who gloat over my distress be ashamed and confounded; may all who exalt themselves over me be clothed with shame and reproach.
Context: David calls for shame upon those who revel in his suffering.

Text: May those who favor my vindication shout for joy and gladness; may they always say, “The LORD be exalted, who delights in His servant’s well-being.”
Context: David envisions a joyful celebration of those who support his cause and praise God for his well-being.

Text: My tongue will proclaim Your righteousness and Your praises all day long.
Context: David vows to continually speak of God’s righteousness and sing His praises.
